intro: Rigiostachys connaroides, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Connaraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The species is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
